CatDescriptText: Lauress Johnson, radio-tv repairman, 1037 Morgan Avenue, Monessen, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 2, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe Negroes, who get public assistance, do more cheating than whites?" answer reads: "I would say that whites most decidedly cheat more than Negroes. For the most part, Negroes do not have the nerve to go through in cheating the government.  They just will not take the chance because they realize that the punishment is 10 times more severe than that for whites."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Lauress Johnson wearing hat, moustache, and jacket with handkerchief in left breast pocket, standing on sidewalk in front of stone building with headless mannequin wearing robe in store window on right
